text:
Hotel ini menyedihkan pelayanannya

1. Proses check in kita harus mengisi sendiri form. Sementara 4 orang petugas resepsionis hanya menonton kita sibuk mengisi.

2. Pesan kamar  sejak tanggal 15 Desember 2022 utk tanggal 26 Desember 2022 (10 hari in advance) 2 kamar  dengan permintaan agar kamar berdekatan. Ternyata saat check in kamar diatur berjauhan sehingga orang tua saya yang sudah sangat tua dengan anak saya yang kecil harus berjauhan. Ini sangat merepotkan.

3. Sampai malam hotel tidak dibersihkan. Padahal sudah memasang sign please clean up room. Kami pergi keluar pukul 09.30 dan sampai malam kami kembali pukul 20.00 kamar masih berantakan. Sangat tidak profesional. Kamar baru dibersihkan pukul 20.10 setelah istri saya marah2 karena berantakan.

owner_response.text:
Dear Perry S,

Warmest greetings from Adiwana Svargaloka.!

We regret to read your review regarding your stay with us. According to your comment and review, we are most concern that you have left with such a negative feeling about Adiwana Svargaloka  service and we sincerely regret to hear this kind of review. As soon as Our manager received this comment, He had investigated this case and find it out in details. It is our endless commitment to always improve our service, facilities and guest satisfaction to be on our top priority. As part of Adiwana Svargaloka standard service, it is clear that our intention is to provide our sincere and high standard of service to all of our valued guests.

Based on your review, we could understand your feeling at that time, and we had noted all your concern. We do apologize for the inconvenience during your registration (according to the government standard) check in process should be done by online registration using guest device. And also, the miss communication regarding your room cleaning due to your request to move to the other room. This comment has been followed up accordingly together with our managers and staff for our further improvement.



We sincerely hope to have another opportunity to invite you again to deliver a better experience to you, once again, thank you and we look forward to meeting you.

Best regards,

Ib.suamba
Reseort Manager

text:
Sungguh fantastis pengalaman tinggal kami di sini dan kami merasa sedih untuk pergi.
Kami mendapatkan  beberapa kekurangan kecil dengan kamar yang kami dapatkan di awal , oleh karena itu kami minta  pindah, dimana hal ini  dilakukan langsung  dengan cepat dan kami sungguh menghargai upgrade yang kami dapatkan.
Hotel ini adalah benar-benar indah. Staf yang hebat dan lokasi yang baik. Kolam Renang nya indah juga.
Kami mendapat penawaran paket yang  termasuk hidangan teh sore hari, tour seharian. Sarapan dan pijat untuk kami masing-masing.
Semuanya sangat bagus, hidangan teh sore hari yang bervariasi  diatur oleh juru masak pada hari itu.
Layanan antar-jemput gratis sangat berguna tetapi  kami  mendapatkan jadwal antar jemput yang bentrok waktunya jadwal kelas lainnya yang berarti harus secepatnya bergegas untuk menyelesaikan kelas yoga untuk mendapatkan bus. 
Ada banyak tangga di properti ini tetapi tidak ada yang terlalu mengangu.
Saya pasti akan kembali lagi.
title: Pasti akan kembali

text:
Location is away from busy street so it’s peaceful. Massage is quite nice. Staff and driver are courteous and helpful. They even insisted the half-day car rent charge (as our initial plan) even though we returned to hotel in the evening—this is beyond our expectation.
Room amenities are wonderful that we even bought home the body lotion.
Only one downside that is not in the hotel’s control: there was a hotel development across the hotel at the valley side so we cannot relax by upper side swimming pool as it’s so noisy.
One tip: Need more sign to let guests know how to find the swimming pool at the bottom. We couldn’t find it.

text:
Really liked this place. Staff was very service minded. Offered cool towels and a welcome drink at arrival. Room was large with balcony and a washroom partly outdoors. Breakfast from menu was tasty and enough. Afternoon tea was also included consist of balinese sweets. Really nice! Hotel area is quite large with several buildings spread out. Some of them seems not to be in use and starting to be taken over by the nature, but all buildings in use where in good shape. Especially the room. They have two pools. One centrally located, one located down by the river. Can be hard to find, but this is a real oasis. We where alone there.

On the opposite site of rhe river a huge hotel complex is under construction, this causes some disturbance, but we knew about it in advance and it was not a major problem.

Out booking stated free transfer to Ubud center, however this was not available. Not sure if it was due to traffic (which is really terrible here), or changed policy. Anyway the distance is walkable even though first part lacks sidewalk.
title: Fantastic oasis close enough to Ubud center

We stayed in this resort for 2 nights and we really liked our stay. The rooms are super clean and comfortable, the staff is very friendly and helpful and the location is just perfect, 5min walking from Campuhan Ridge Walk. Also we absolutely loved their soups which is a must for us Portuguese. The only thing is as a light sleeper I was woken every morning at 5am by the local rooster but heavier sleepers may not find this as issue! text:
Svarga Loka is a great hotel set in the midst of the jungle of Ubud. We really enjoyed our room (wonderful balcony and bathrooms with views into the jungle). The rooms are very large too. 

The staff was really amazing, both at the front desk as well as in the restaurant. The breakfast is good but make sure to have a meal a la carte from the restaurant for lunch or dinner - it's really delicious.

The laundry service is great and very fast (less than 24h turnaround). We received large discounts (e.g. 120k IDR flat fee for a full laundry bag) after having used the service a few times during your stay.

Some smaller issues we had were that the mosquito nets around the bed didn't fully close and we had quite a lot of ants in our room, the latter of which I can only assume to be a common thing in Ubud. 

One part that definitely needs attention however is the wifi setup at the hotel. The wifi only works well in the lobby and in the restaurant, with speeds even up to 25Mbit. In the rooms however you won't have any connection. If you're lucky you'll get 1-2Mbit at 6am when no other guests are awake yet. At all other times the Wifi simply wouldn't work and so you're left without any Internet connection because there also isn't any cell service around the hotel grounds.
title: Great hotel and staff, Wifi needs to be fixed

text:
I had toured Bali on a yoga retreat for nearly a month and stayed at many amazing accommodations but my time spent at Svarga Loka was far and away the most enriching.  This was due to a combination of reasons;  

(STAFF)
	First and foremost all of the staff there (from the waitresses, to the masseuses at the spa, to the front desk personal and the management) were all so welcoming, friendly, and respectful.  It was so lovely to be surrounded by smiling faces of people who all clearly were happy to be there.  I chatted up several different employees who each said the work community there was like loving family.  I felt very at home right away at Svarga Loka and the family atmosphere of the employees I think very much contributed this easeful feeling.

(YOGA SPOTS at SL)
   Svarga Loka was the last stop of many on our yoga retreat.  Of all the places I saw in Bali, SL offered the most breathtaking and diverse places to practice yoga.  It seemed almost like a dream, rolling out the yoga mat (which they provided) on a deck next to a flowing river & over hanging trees, or in the jungle next to a temple, or pool side on a marble floor, overlooking vast open space with rice paddies and palm trees lining the far side of the gorge. With quietness, and ample places to find time and space to yourself, it also made for a wonderful place for effective meditation. I love being in nature and SL provided this also.  I found deep peacefulness and privacy at Svarga Loka. It is a place that naturally lends itself to quieting the mind and raising your vibration.

(LOCATION)
 Another great benefit was (while being secluded and quite,) it is a very short walk to many wonderful places in Ubud;  places to see authentic Balinese culture, fabulous restaurants, and excellent yoga studios: all a short walk away from the front gates. 

(RESTAURANT & SPA)
	 The restaurant and spa at Svarga Loka were both absolutely wonderful.  Despite being so close to so many great restaurants, I primarily dined at the SL resort because I loved everything on the menu that I tried!
	I could write at length on how much I enjoyed the spa but I will keep it brief as possible.  The ambiance of the spa is something from a beautiful, fantastical dream; multi level wooden villa’s built into the slope of the valley, with breathtaking views peering through the trees to the flowing river below.  Their range of therapeutic massage offering was remarkable.  My personal favorite was the Shirodhara treatment in which, after receiving a full body massage, warm coconut oil is poured onto your forehead for twenty minutes; it was amazing.  (I also loved the infrared sauna which helped open my often congested sinuses!)

(HEALING CENTER)
	With all this, I found Svarga Loka’s greatest amenity to be their healing center. With a wide variety of treatments, and healers & mindfulness coaches who are truly passionate about what they do, I found that my stay at Svarga Loka contributed to my personal growth in unexpected and powerful ways.  Along with being a yoga teacher, I am an artist and writer; I found moments there of such clarity and peace that words poured out onto the page effortlessly; the constant pull of future and past seemed to melt away as I become more deeply alive and happy in the present moment. 

I could not recommend this place enough; truth be told I ended up staying an extra week longer than I had planned because I was enjoying the time so much I did not want to leave! Have a magical journey! Safe travels!!
title: love

text: Recently voted one of the 5 best Wellness Reatreats In 2017, and it's not hard to see why. The healthy food is a delight, the massages and treatments are excellent, and the service is given with generosity and love. It is also nestled well into nature with stunning views and vegetation. There is also the fantastic vegan and health food restaurant Alchemy just next door for that extra boost of internal vitality; and the famous Yoga Barn studio for yoga and ecstatic dance is near by for any desired additions to what's already on offer by way of great mind and body expanding courses and treatments. The flower bath jutting out of the rocks into the river was one of the peak experiences of my holiday. Lying bathed in warm fragrant water after a beautiful massage, with the wild river running a few metres underneath you is pure natural bliss. One small suggestion is that the mosquito nets and screens need a bit of maintenance which I am assured is being currently attended to. The rest of our stay was perfection personified. Thank you for such a wonderful stay. Host Richard is one of the best managers you will find!
title: Exceptional wellness and Spa treatments

The hotel can set up various day trips, has a yoga room with group yoga and group AM hikes.  I loved this location.

text: This resort is a hidden gem at the heart of Ubud, nestled cozily on a woody hillside that meets with the river. It's an incredibly peaceful place that invigorates the visitor; there's a calming energy you can find there. The pathways from spa to room to restaurant wind up and down the hillside, immersing you in the Balinese woods. The food at the restaurant was great - there were healthy options to enjoy. Make sure to try the spa as well - definitely a wonderful experience listening to the river while enjoying a Balinese massage! Rooms were clean and staff was always friendly and helpful. :) The location of the resort was also a plus as it is centrally located in Ubud. I would highly recommend this resort to everyone!
title: Peaceful Retreat in the Heart of Bali

text: I was with a group of 12 ladies who recently stayed in this incredible place.  The surrounding lush forest took you to another world away from the crazy busy-ness of Ubud just a few minutes away.  The restaurant is located down a series of stairs which is not so good for bad knees and people with fitness challenges.  Once there though the very accomodating, patient,  staff plus the view over the Campuan river and the healthy selection of food certainly makes one forget.  The rooms are spacious, clean, and very comfortable.  I had room  310 and while you could hear the roosters early in the morning, it just added to the whole atmosphere.  We met Richard the GM who encouraged us to use the Managers swimming pool so we did!  A couple of things I feel could be improved upon - a bar fridge per room to keep milk and water cold, plus other items bought from the supermarket and maybe in order to attract more people to dine in - the restaurant be bought up to the top level say closer to reception or have breakfast where it is and have another facility for lunches and dinners as it is quite dark going up and down the stairs which did put a few of us off dining in.  Apart from that - Richard it was great to meet you, awesome to meet and deal with your wonderful staff, and fabulous to stay in your outstanding resort!!   We will definitely revisit when we come back again - this time with my family in tow!
title: Beautiful location, peaceful resort and wonderful staff

owner_response.text:
Kia ora TAWAuckland!
Terrific to hear from you, may i say what a pleasure it was to have your group of 12 ladies in Svarga Loka Resort, we enjoyed so much your energy here and the interaction with the staff from the restaurant, lobby and spa to the special ceremony with you the day before you all departed.
Yes one thing we can do is offer the use of the residential pool which saves the walk down to the riverside pool! It's just the morning sun down below that is hard not to like!
We also appreciate very much your feedback regarding installing mini-bars in the rooms, meanwhile may i offer to any prospective guests coming soon we have two upstairs service kitchens where we can refrigerate any items. Of course at the moment it still doesn't work for milk with tea or coffees in room, but we certainly take on board your suggestion with thanks.
For now its a bit difficult with such a stunning riverside location for Sanjawani restaurant but we are most certainly aware of the issues climbing stairs and currently respond with room service but i am very grateful to you for your suggestion and we will definitely consider how we can best service all guests with the dining location options.
We look forward to welcoming you and your family back home to Svarga Loka Resort and send Bali blessings to you all.
Richard
Richard Williams
GM
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: I spent an unforgettable week at this fantastic wellness resort. Hidden just 5 minutes from Ubud town, although a world away, this resort offers a peaceful paradise to anyone wishing to rejuvenate and recharge. The location is superb, set amongst the rain forrest leading down to the Campuhan river.. The complimentary activities offer great value, I did Yoga plus the most beautiful morning walk through the rice paddies, as well as my first try at martial arts! The rooms are comfy and spacious, the spa offers wonderful balinese treatments, the staff are fantastic and the healthy meal options are just what I needed to get my health back on track. Highly recommend!!
title: Amazing hidden treasure!!

text:
Just returned from staying here with a group of 12 ladies. Hidden on the slopes of the Campuhan River among  lush forest teaming with bird life and silence. perfect peace and tranquility. A great place to remove all stress, no noise but offers Yoga classes etc. which i did not partake in. I lazed in  my Master Suit of 150sq.mt. and was well worth the extra I paid. My group all had beautiful rooms and decks as well.
The breakfast beside the river, great staff and excellent service.This Resort is close to some amazing restaurants outside the gate, and offers a free shuttle if you wish to go shopping in the main streets of Ubud, only 5 minutes away and in walking distance.A week of being in Heaven. 
My 4th trip to Bali and this so far the BEST Hotel I have ever stayed in world wide, over my 15 years as a Tour Company and leader. I am planning on returning next year, with my husband.
title: Paradise never found anywhere else as yet.

text: We just spent 5 nights at Svarga Loka and were enchanted by the place. A mix of traditional and contemporary, we love the Balinese structure, decor and ambiance of the hotel. Our deluxe suite with its beautiful patio and mesmerizing views on the rice fields was very enjoyable. The bathroom faces the same direction and is open yet private (closed with a mosquito screen). We enjoyed the peaceful morning breakfasts on the lovely terrace at the bottom of the hotel, overlooking the river. Service is excellent! Sri and Debi at reception were super hospitable and kind. We felt treated like royals at Svarga Loka. It's a great address in Ubud...plus it's walking distance to the center of town! Free shuttle to Ubud provided nevertheless.
title: Fantastic Balinese stay

The staff were warm, friendly and so helpful. They upgraded my room, organised a cake for me on my birthday (complete surprise!) and were full of knowledge and resources when it came to organising trips. The spa also provided a wonderful massage by the river which was pure bliss. This was an unforgettable experience and I will most definitely return.

text:
This is a unique sort of resort - so think carefully before you choose. Its not for everyone because of its design and character which promotes a stay which is away from Ubud town and seclusion. 

This list may be good or bad depending on what you are looking for:
1. There is no TV in the room.
2. Plenty of mosquitoes especially in the main check-in building.
3. Several flights of steps to the breakfast area and to the pool.
4. Small dip pool - not suitable for swimming.
5. Free walk at the Campuhan Ridge every other day.
6. Free 1-hour yoga every other day.
7. Free martial arts session in the evening.

We stayed two days only and it was an interesting experience but will not return. Its not for us.
title: Niche Resort is not for everyone

text: We stayed at Svarga Loka for three nights and really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were neat but there were a lot of bugs [I guess this is to be expected when you are staying in the jungle but it was still a little annoying]. The breakfast was pretty good but we would have liked some more Indonesian options. I suggest against getting coffee here as it isn't very nice. The juices are a nice alternative, they are really tasty. They yoga classes are great and it was a nice way to start off the new year. The pools are clean and in a beautiful location [surrounded by gardens and trees]. The hotel was in a good location, just out of Ubud but still walking distance.
title: Peaceful and Tropical

text:
We booked this room as we thought it had a view over the valley but unfortunately there is not really a view at all from a standard room. The room is very small. I think the photos are miss leading on their website. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The swimming pool is beutiful. 
 You can book a hotel in the rice fields or near the ayung river for a fraction of the price. I think this place is way overpriced.  Definitely would not return.
title: Overpriced

text: This resort is an island of tranquility amongst the chaos of Bali.. Our room was marginal at first, the neighbors roosters started up every morning about 3:30am and the air conditioner didn't cut it.....the management was very accommodating and moved us to a better, cooler and quieter room no questions asked.  They will do anything they can to make your stay pleasant.
title: Very Tranquil, True Jungle Feel

text: My husband and I initially booked 6 nights at Svarga Loka; the staff, the grounds, the energy and surroundings made us extend our stay for the entire 2 weeks we were in Bali. The hotel is totally chill and relaxing. The bed is amazing and so comfortable, offerings are everywhere on the property, the infinity pools are stunning with views of the river and rice terraces, the restaurant is delicious. The spa treatment was probably one of the most relaxing experiences of my life. The staff was so kind and helpful. The hotel has yoga and activities available for guests and is walking distance to Alchemy and Intuitive Flow. If you have a challenging time with stairs I would recommend staying at another hotel close by. We really loved staying at Svarga Loka.
title: Extended Our Stay

text: The resort is along the river which is nice but you have to walk down lots of steps to get to the restaurant and then up those steps!! The room (Superior) was a bit disappointing - small, awkward bathroom, hot water takes 10 mins to come through. The roosters start crowing loudly at 3.30am - had to sleep with noise cancelling headphones in. But the staff are very nice, the spa massages are terrific. You can walk to town but the traffic pretty hectic. Alchemy health-food & coconut juice bar nearby which were great. Yoga class most days quite good. They provide a shuttle bus in to town but not back (?) Wifi not great in the room but OK at reception area which was a pain.
title: Great spa but rooms small, bathrooms not great and lots of steps!!

text: WOW ! The jungle resort is outstanding. Built in an old temple, the stay gives one a rustic yet modern feel. Stayed in suite, felt like a queen :D . If you don't like frogs, don't stay. They come as the gift from jungle. Everyday i would find at least 2 jumping in my bedroom. The things which impressed me , the location of the restaurant, just in the forest overlooking  a river. A calm swimming pool by the side. Breakfast is not very impressive, but its okay. Its a bit away from Ubud market, you would either need to walk for around 30 mins or take a taxi. No shuttle service from hotel. Smoking is not allowed in the premises of the resort.
title: Awesome ... if only the frogs weren't there

text:
My husband and i loved our 5 night stay at Svarga Loka,
The hotel has its own temple and it was built respecting nature and wild life. Breakfasts are simple and very tasty, with an excellent variety of fruits.
for dinner i would recomend  to go out to Ubud, just because the culinary offer is amazing and at very different Price range.

Beds are great and every thing in the room is for sale, bed sheets, art crafts, paintings etc...

Even though we rented a motobike, the Hotel offers free transport to main Street in Ubud, so this is a plus!
We will come back for sure! =)
title: A BEAUTIFUL STAY

text:
Had a great experience with Svarga Loka. Everyone from the owner, the management, the spa, and the kitchen staff were very welcoming and friendly. My wife and I stayed here last summer during our honeymoon and we were made to feel like royalty. I especially enjoyed the yoga classes and programs where we got to help make the daily offerings that was part of the Balinese Hindu ritual - both of which were free. My wife and I also took a meditation class, which was not free, but a valuable experience nonetheless. 

One of the things I liked the best about Svarga Loka was its location. It was in Ubud, but just past the Campuan Bridge and not the commercial center (actually overlooking the Campuan River). This was perfect for us because we felt like we were in a peaceful place, full of greenery and away from the mobs of tourists, but at the same time, we were a short walk from the restaurants and temples, so we could go out athere night to see the Balinese dances and soak up the culture.
title: Great resort, away from Ubud crowds, but walking distance from cultural highlights

text: Great hotel clinging to the steep river slopes near Ubud.  The grounds of the hotel cover a steep, forested hillside.  Beautiful location, but lots of steps.  The eating area is set on an overlook of the river valley making a great spot for birding.  The yoga class was very good.  The rooms were nice and clean.  The food was great at breakfast as well.  The pools looked amazing even though I didn't use them.  Kids would love this place.  The only small complaint I have is the windows in our room do not close all the way and thus would allow bugs and warm air in.  The room had ac, but this did little due to the open design of the window.  Other than that the place was great.  The location was very good, the staff were wonderful, helpful, and very friendly.  The center of Ubud is an easy walk away or there are places to shop and eat one minute walking down the street.  Finding taxis was very easy.

user_location.name: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States

title: Amazing hotel near town.

text: We chose this hotel as it's right near the centre of Ubud, but hidden away in the peace of the forest. The grounds are beautiful, staff attentive - it's a great place to get away from the hustle and bustle of Ubud. Our room had the most amazing view over the valley, and was huge (with two kingsize beds, oddly!) The bathrooms are open to the elements which I really liked. Breakfast is good (not amazing, but good). We didn't try the activities, but lots of other guests seemed to be enjoying them. The staff were very helpful with booking cars and activities.
title: Hidden gem in Ubud!

text:
Amazing place.  Every detail from food to comfort to nature was carefully taken care so we had an experience that will last a life time.  
A great experience either as vacation or a place where your body and mind can heal and revitalize.  Yoga, meditation, massage, good food, are all ways to help the body come back to balance.  And Svarga 
Loka has them all!
title: Relax and renew

text: We had a good stay here. The highlight of our stay was dealing with their employee named Erna - she was wonderful and kind. The only reason we rated this a 4 out of 5 is that it's not a resort for everyone - you have to be a lover of nature, bugs, and frequent lizards and geckos in the room - but if you're comfortable with that the whole place has a charming authentic Balinese feel to it. The staff were wonderful and accommodating. Laundry is a bit expensive at the hotel - better to go somewhere local for it. The bigger of the two pools we went to had some white mildew on the wall, but I am sure that can be cleaned easily. Wifi was also bad in the rooms but good in the lobby. Didn't get a chance to enjoy the classes unfortunately but we are told they are wonderful.
title: Good stay!

text:
We liked the location great for relaxing. And a nice walk into town (they do have some free

The outside bathroom was a pain in got lots of bites in the shower which was off putting.

The room was nice but we had lots of ants in the bathroom. 

The breakfast was in a nice location but wasn't always great.

This place could be really nice but is a bit fadded and run down at the moment.

Not sure  we'd stay here again
title: Nice location lots of misquotes

text:
Travelled here recently. Beautiful place and staff extremely helpful! Could not fault them.
If you visit you definetly want to just get away from it all. We had to request a fridge to be brought to our room as there was not one there. No television or anything either so make sure you enjoy your company! 
If you have a room with the shower outside make sure you check there is no one watching because I was caught being watched by a few farmers working in the paddocks opposite. 
If you don't like stairs don't go. Approx 100 stairs to get to breakfast and more on top to the bottom pool.
Overall good.
title: Acquired taste

text: On arrival, stay were really friendly and helpful. On our first night our room smelt like a dead mouse so we got moved to a different room at 9pm. We didn't get fresh towels our whole stay and woke up to construction workers at 6am in the morning. Buffet breakfast has poor choices and wasn't even running one morning. The events they say they offer rarely run because no one attends. Not a very good first stay at ubud.
title: Not the best visit

text: This Hotel is very close to the Bridges Restaurant in Ubud.  It takes about 15 minutes to walk to Monkey Forrest rd.  The hotel is set amongst lots of trees and would not be suitable for anyone unable to walk up and down stairs, it was very quiet when we were there, not many rooms were taken.  The staff are very helpful and willing to assist in any way.  We had one of the best massages ever.  there are 2 pools one at the top and the other down 100 or so stairs. There is no fridge or TV in the rooms, TV didn't worry us but a fridge would have been nice.  pay the extra a get a deluxe room, the views are worth it.
title: A Great Surprise

text: I love Svarga Loka. The rooms are clean and pristine and the bed and pillows are one of the most comfortable I've ever experienced (even better than home). I really enjoyed the spa which is overlooking the river. My friends and I got a 2 1/2 hour massage and wrap treatment and it was divine. The staff is friendly and accommodating. I will definitely be back!
title: Beautiful, Peaceful and close to downtown

text: In the jungle, but still within walking distance of central Ubud and amazingly luxurious. The photos you see on the net simply does not justify the beauty and tranquility of this hotel. Only thing I did miss was a bar fridge for cold water.
title: Picture Perfect

text: A lovely establishment from the moment you arrive with service, drink, cold towel and a smile.  It is a unique setting to say the least.  The room was clean and comfortable and they even prepared happy birthday cake slices in our room for our special occasion, just lovely.  The massage we had at the spa included with our room was exceptional.  The service and setting is not to be missed.  The restaurant is fantastic with great breakfast and view and the dinner we had was lovely.  Overall the staff attend to all you need and the stairs help keep you fit on your stay.  Also has what appears to be a great wellness program but due to our timing we were unable to participate.  Ubud is a must to visit and you can walk into town or use transfer from resort.
title: A hidden jem in a beautiful setting with all you need

text:
I have just returned from a 10 day stay in Bali where we stayed at the Svarga Loka Resort in Ubud.  We stayed in a superior room - two queen size beds (very comfortable, lovely sheets and pillows) with mosquito nets and air-conditoning.  It was clean, quiet with all the small touches of pulling bed down at nignt - with frangipani on pillow and all tidied up beautifully.  The bathroom was unique in that it was open...but private.  The staff were absolutely wonderful ... as all Balinese people are (just in their nature) who couldn't do enough to help us and always with a smile.  They have different activities that are included in the price such as yoga, basket offering making, a 2 hour walk with guide through villages and rice fields - the only thing missing which was disappointing was that there were no meditation classes which we had thought  there would be.  There are many steps (108 from our room) to the restaurant but we loved that for exercise, especially after our included breakfast. There are probably about another 15 to the absolutely fabulous pool and spa retreat but again the destination is worth it. There is another pool up at reception level as well.
 It is only about a 30 minute walk to the palace in Ubud which was lined with shops of interest. In the local street there are many really good eateries and massage place an of course the galleries which are a big part of the Ubud culture.  All in all a wonderful holiday, beautiful people and such a beautiful culture - a culture we can all learn from.
title: The Bali Flavour

text:
We just checked out this afternoon and have headed to another part of Bali. Already missing both Ubud and Svarga Loka...the perfect setting and location from which to enjoy this magical area.

The resort itself has the feel of a retreat with an emphasis on tranquility, beauty, nature, un-imposing yet impeccable service and discreet style and comfort. The spa itself is sublime, as were the massages.

Thank you to the team for your hospitality, your efforts to meet all our needs, however small, were noticed and appreciated.

Will definitely consider staying here again next time we are in Ubud.

Highly recommended!!
title: perfect setting for a visit to Ubud

text: I really like this hotel which is in the jungle with kinds of unknown flowers and bushes, you can spend you leisure time on walking round the hotel, also you can choose interesting activities that organized by hotel, such as Yoga. People who has good manners and warmhearted to help you.
title: Excellent

text:
Wonderful location with 124 beautifully designed steps/stairs to get to the restaurant. Views are breathtaking and rooms are very modern. We stayed in Superior rooms 302 & 303 and they were really well designed and maintained. Loved the semi-open bathroom & shower. 

Only complain is no refrigerator to keep water/drinks cold. Also, restaurant menu is like 4 items; it's a joke when compared to the variety of food you can get anywhere in Bali. Found a great Indian take-away place called Queens (next to Ubud Palace where most hotels drop their guests). The poor delivery girl brought food on time - twice - in the heavy downpour that this island gets drenched pretty much every other day.
title: Great Location

owner_response.text: We apologize for the lack of menu selection. The ice box in the rooms has been discussed by management and owners before-we will review the topic again. Thank you for your comments.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
I checked in two hours ago and I've already fallen in love with the place. The surroundings are beautiful and the staff delightful. I would certainly reccomend Svarga Loka to anyone staying in Ubud. 
Whilst having lunch just after we arrived, the Chef overheard me on the telephone mentioning that it's my mother's birthday - before we knew it my mother was presented with a birthday cake and all the restaurant staff sang happy birthday. It was so unexpected, and very kind. Also, as it's surrounded by jungle there are quite a few bugs - I can be a bit pathetic so I had to ask at reception for someone to remove a caterpillar from our otherwise spotless and immaculate room. Not only did someone remove the offending critter instantly, but his boss then came to check if I wanted the brand new sheets changing as the caterpillar had momentarily touched them! It really is impeccable service and we couldn't have found a more enchanting location.
title: Utterly fantastic - highly recommended!

text:
We stayed as a family with teenagers for 3 nights in this newly set up hotel. The setting is very beautiful, it looks like you are surrounded by rainforest. All rooms and other amenities are built around the existing trees, so it all feels like a Swiss family Robinson treehouse ECO experience. Rooms are very nice and big. There are beautiful views from several spots to the river and waterfall. 
Be sure to book a room including the spa, because that's really heaven like, with a direct view above the river. The sound of the water is very therapeutic, and the spa personnel is really professional. 
The breakfast is ok, but my  advise would be to include real coffee at the lower restaurant. 
Swimmingpool is nice, but not very big.
Be aware that the grounds include a lot of stairs, so only for (wannabe) fit customers.
We loved this place and would definitely go back there.
title: Paradise or heaven

photos.caption: View from inside one spa room

text:
From the moment I first arrived at this resort I loved it!  It was pouring with rain with thunder and lightening,but we were instantly given umbrellas and warmly welcomed by the staff.  We were upgraded to a junior suite with a beautiful view over the valley and river.  The room was spacious, comfortable with a semi-outdoor bathroom and nice balcony with a day bed.  I spent a lot of time just sitting on the day bed reading looking out over the jungle - so fantastic.

The resort itself is on a hillside so there are steps.  I'm very active so I enjoyed the walk down to the restaurant and pool area. It's worth it so you can eat right next to the river.  The pool was lovely - nice to cool off in with the humidity.  The food was beautiful - homemade jams, lots of healthy local options.  The staff were all wonderful, friendly and happy to assist whenever we needed anything.  As for the free activities - I didn't do anything but my husband did the yoga and really enjoyed it. 

The best thing for me was the resort was far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Ubud but close enough to walk in.  I did the walk about 4 times over the 3 days we were there and never tired of it (allow about 15 minutes - a bit tricky down the hill but once you're on the main road an easy walk).  You can't hear any traffic noise at all from the rooms - just the sounds of the jungle.  There are bugs though - turn off your bathroom light at night and keep the door shut and that usually keeps most of the away!  

The only one little negative is a bar fridge or ice would've been nice to keep the beers cold. 
We would stay again.
title: Peaceful, relaxing yet you can still walk into town

text: A lovely spot on a hillside going down to the river. You are right behind the main street by the Hugo Blanco Museum but you don't see or hear any other hotels. The restaurant and spa are right by the water and it is very peaceful. Rooms are spacious and brand new and the staff couldn't be friendlier. Highly recommended!
title: Beautiful, quiet, and close to town center

text: 2 days stay with a group of friends, we were welcome with complimentary delicious drinks, extremely high class and friendly staffs. The beds were big and clean. Breakfast included with a friendly chef serving you. Great place for couples.
title: Hilltop Villa

photos.caption: Breakfast time...juz look at the view

text: Stayed for 2 nights in this place as a part of my ubud stay. ... got room number 205 which was very close to the reception and the main entrance which was good. . The staff is Very warm , friendly and very helpful. ... they got tours organised for us.... The hotel has shuttle service to ubud center and on request took us to the close by supermarket as well. .. The best thing is its in the middle of the jungle even though it's just a 15 to 20 min from ubud Centre. ..The breakfast is served in the swanjivini resturant which is besides the river and is a awesome setting. ....do carry  mosquito repellant with you. ..nights do tend to geta little creepy. . But then it's part of the charm for this place..
title: A truly hidden gem

photos.caption: View of the river from lower pool area
Swimming pool on the upper levels

text: We had the pleasure of staying here a few days ago! If you like Spa treatments this is a must in Ubud, the setting is truly gorgeous above the river and the ladies at the spa are warm and very professional ! The lunches are good value for money and the staff are very attentive! If you don't want to be in the heart of the rustle and bustle of Ubud this is a great space! Peaceful and truly beautiful with all the lush green vegetation!
title: A jungle oasis

text:
Hote in a nice location, just above a river (river view) and very close to city center (by byke around 5 min). 
The hotel have good facilities and sorrounded by a charming atmosphere, however, in my stay the main pool was out of service and the overall staff service and restaurant are only average.
title: Average

text:
This hotel astounded me in how it was an oasis of peace and tranquillity pretty much in the middle of main Ubud! I was quite surprised to notice the property’s proximity to the hubbub areas of Jalan Raya Ubud and Monkey Forest Road (25 mins walking). 
The hotel really takes its stated aim of immersing you in nature seriously. It is admirable how they have tried to disturb neither nature nor the ruins, by building around old trees and temple walls, rather than razing these down. Indeed, this is what lends it its unique charm. Many rooms have really scenic views of either the river or rice fields (ours was the latter).  Our Junior Suite also came with a really spacious balcony and ample seating for you to lounge around after a hot day out in the sun. And it gets eerily quiet after sunset, with only the night-time noise of crickets and other insects to lull you to sleep.
There’s a host of in-hotel activities that the hotel plans for its resident guests (you will be given the weekly schedule for this upon arrival). We really enjoyed our Yoga classes and the morning walk through a nearby ridge organised by the hotel.
The staff was polite, and extremely efficient and helpful in arranging other activities with reliable external operators. On the day we had to start at an unearthly 2:30 am for our volcano trek, the restaurant staff had quite thoughtfully packed our breakfast for us!
Having said that, guests may need to watch out for the following:
1.	The hotel rightly advises you not to stay here if you have kids below 12. Its steep steps that you have to constantly climb up and down to go from your room to the restaurant or front desk can be a pain. The same goes for the elderly or infirm, and those with knee problems. And there is not much to light your way after nightfall.
2.	This place is not for those who mind the creepy-crawlies. There is a lot of flora that invites its attendant fauna. I had a 3-feet long snake cross my path! Also, do take adequate insect repellent with you. Our bathroom was high-tech and luxurious, but semi-open, with just chick/bamboo blinds to separate it from the outside. Insects and other creatures do manage to come through in hordes.
3. The semi-open bathroom also poses a security risk. it means that if someone were to come onto your balcony, they could enter the bathroom, and through that easily come into your room. Nothing like that happened while we were there, but technically could.
4.	The lighting in the rooms is too dim. The hotel may need to look into that. It’s practically difficult to read or look for things in your suitcase in that light.
5.	The vegetarian menu on offer in the Sanjeevani restaurant is dismal. There were literally no more than three vegetarian dishes in the main course.  The restaurant staff were unable to accommodate my request to give me a few more options — quite contrary to the claims made on their website. For a hotel that promotes itself for its focus on wellness, they really should consider expanding their vegetarian menu.
Despite some of these issues, i would recommend it highly to nature lovers. It has a dream-like quality to it which makes you forget your routine and workaday life within a few hours of settling in.
Stayed here for 6 nights in early September with my husband.
title: Truly a paradise for nature lovers

text:
This hotel has such lovely views of the jungle and extremely nice pools. A lot of reviews mention the stairs which yes would be a issue in some circumstances but not all. I personally loved everything about this hotel. The service was great the staff were all extremely polite and helpful with everything from ordering taxis recommending places to go and directions.

The hotel its self is really close to the centre of the heart of Ubud and some great restaurants. I personally didn't use the spa here as it was a little pricey however it looked amazing and looked out on to the lake and jungle. All of the towels here smelt like heaven I knew I was in a nice hotel which had a spa. The room we stayed in was also gorgeous. We had a huge shower cubicle with a rainforest shower head and a balcony. I loved a lot about this hotel the only 2 downsides I personally would say is that the noise in a morning was so extremely loud. I woke up panicking the first night wondering what was going on, It was all of the jungles animals waking up or something!! It was incredible I learnt to love it in the end as I felt at peace with the nature! I didn't like to doors at this hotel they lock with an actual padlock and you can push this open and pretty much see everything and easily squeeze through the door. I felt it lacked the security for that. Although its a road to get to the hotel it doesn't mean other people staying wont snoop in other peoples rooms. We felt as though we had to hide everything behind the bathroom wall so It look like nothing was inside. Only a small thing we was up some stairs and round a corner but I wouldn't have felt safe on a ground floor room.

I loved this hotel and would highly recommend even with its faults. The security problem is only small and isn't something to be concerned about at all as it is a very quiet and tranquil place.
title: Charming and hidden gem

text: My partner and i stayed here for a week and it was sensational, the service was amazing all the staff are so nice, the meals at the resort were amazing and reasonably priced and its in a great position with in walking distance to the main strip in ubud or a cheap taxi ride as long as you get the unmetered taxis. Will definitely head back here when in Bali again, highly recommend staying here if you are after a peaceful holiday. The only thing we weren't overly happy with was the prices at the resort spa but there is another spa right at the entry to the resort and their prices were very reasonable.
title: The name says it all 'Heaven'.

text:
My boyfriend and I stayed 3 nights in a standard double which was perfectly adequate seeing as we were out and about and not really in the room.  Our first room was 305 but we got moved the next day due to noisy building work at 7am and cockerels cock a doodle doing all through the night.  Got moved to 108, couldn't hear the building work and the water feature drowned out the cockerels!  

Very tranquil location set in the grounds of an old temple but be warned, there are lots of steps as it's built on a hillside leading down to the river.  Neither pool was very busy but they are not in the sun all day if this is what you want.  Can recommend the rose petal bath by the river and massage - excellent.  Hotel ran a shuttle into Ubud centre and back at various times which was very useful. You could walk, perhaps 1/2 hour, but we didn't bother because it was too hot.  Staff at the hotel, like everywhere else in Bali, were very helpful.

There don't appear to be proper taxi companies in Ubud, just people with taxi signs and then they take you to their car.  You really do need to fix a price - and this does become tiring after a while so if we went to Ubud again, we'd probably stay somewhere right in the centre so we could walk everywhere.
title: Tranquil

text:
To describe this hotel in a review is nearly impossible in my opinion.  The atmosphere created by staff and the vision of Svarga Loka are difficult to describe without smiling.  During a long tour of SE Asia we ended up here in mid-August and it exceeded any expectations we had.
Our room was stunning and featured an outdoor shower, luxurious sink, and washroom.  Food in the restaurant has something for everyone and the quality was top notch.  Room service was prompt for Balinese standards and considering the trek up many stairs to get to the rooms.  I would say though that the staff is truly what makes this such an enjoyable place to unwind.  During our stay my wife fell ill and the owner ended up driving her to the clinic and then to get several groceries on the way home to ensure she had what she needed to beat her bug.  In several years of travel across many continents I have never been treated as well as I was at Svarga Loka.  
The location of the hotel is not central to Ubud and that is a blessing as the view into the river below is fantastic.  The hotel has a driver if when you need to leave and there are also taxis everywhere in Ubud so getting around is not a problem.  We actually found an incredible driver standing at the archway gate to enter the hotel's street who was able to show us anything we wanted.
Any stay in Ubud is incomplete without some time at Svarga Loka.  Thank you for an amazing stay.
title: Heaven on Earth

text:
Unfortunately Ubud was our second week in Bali.  Prior to this we’d been spoiled by the luxurious villa accommodation in Seminyak therefore, by comparison, we did not like Svarga Loka as much.  It is a new resort and appeared well maintained, clean and modern rooms. From overhearing conversations at breakfast etc, people seemed to enjoy the activities offered (yoga etc) but if you are not there for a whole week you may find it hard to take part as most are only offered twice a week so times etc might not suit.  I think if we'd been coming for the activities we'd have rated the hotel higher, but since we were merely using it as a base for our Ubud stay, then some observations:
-	We were originally placed in room 206 which did not have a balcony.  This proceeded to be built from the next morning, before we were up.  We were out most of the day and the next day, however upon returning at 4pm, work was still noisly continuing so we discussed with reception who kindly moved us rooms.  However, it was disappointing to have been put in this room in the first place – perhaps no other rooms were available, although not being peak season, this is unlikely.
-	I found room 206 extremely noisy despite hailing from the countryside and living next to a railway line!!  Booking a resort in the forest, this is expected, however as a room tip – our second room of 407 was much quieter.  This was with the exception of workers brushing leaves on the outside paths/decking areas from very early (6.30am) and a chainsaw one morning (7.30am).
-	The resort spans a large area with the restaurant down the hill (>100 steps).  This has a lovely view overlooking the river but should be borne in mind if elderly/immobile.  Once down, breakfast was okay.  A large selection with cooking eggs etc to order however staff should bear in mind it is in the middle of a forest and take precautions against the insects accordingly – one the first morning I went to pick up a dish of granola to find a fly on top and on the other morning we had breakfast there, such put me off the pancakes and pastries.
-	We enjoyed lunch at the restaurant on our arrival however – freshly made to order and the juice drinks were extremely yummy!
-	Beware if booking a taxi from the airport with the resort.  Upon inquiring we were told 500 IDR which we said no to as we’d seen many operators offering 250 from Ubud.  This was agreed however when we got out at the airport and paid 250, the taxi driver disputed this, stating it was 350.  He then phoned the resort and let us speak to reception who suggested to resolve the issue we return to the resort!!! (An hour away……..).
-  I didn't like the walk in to Ubud - no pavements, steep hill with busy traffic but the last shuttle bus is 6pm and there are no return shuttles offered,simply drop offs.  Best to take a torch!
title: A fine stay - but not a place which excited me that I'd rave about to friends!

text: No doubt access and finding this resort will be a challenge. But once you arrive, you will see that you have reached a completely different world.  From the time we arrived till we checked out, we can't help but marvel at the fine setting and peaceful environment. There is no TV in the room and even the door "lock" is the old fashion traditional wooden latch. The bed is big, no. it's huge. Breakfast is set above a river and the pool. While it is simple breakfast, it is sufficient and tasty. My only regret is we are not staying longer to enjoy the other facilities such as the spa.
title: Hidden Treasure

text: This hotel was really comfortable to stay in. The settings is gorgeous. They seem like they are still undergoing some construction but it didn't bother us. It should be really nice after the yoga room and sitting areas are finished. Free yoga classes and buffet. Nice towel elephant on the bed. There is a shuttle to the ubud center, otherwise a 10 minute walk down a traffic filled steep hill. I'd say that's the main drawback. It's close to an amazing juice bar and bakery cafe. Ubud is really great, we stayed four nights and could have gone longer.
title: Beautiful setting, comfortable stay

text:
The room is very very nice. The bathroom is big and comfortable, the bed is perfect and very large, the hotel is very silent and the jungle around is magnificent! The people in the hotel is very kind and are always ready to help. 
The only problem is the breakfast. It has a lot of local food (rice, noodles, chicken..) but doesn't have a cereal or a decent yogurt. The only yogurt they serve is a terrible jam (a lot) with a teaspoon of yogurt. Awful! And the restaurant is downstairs so if you have any kind of problem to walk, think twice. The view in the restaurant is nice and quiet, but the stairs are a problem.
title: Room very good but the breakfast is not

text: We just spent a week at the Svarga Loca Reaort in Ubud.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  The place is located in a quiet, wooded setting above a river near the center of town but outside the hustle and bustle.  The staff was welcoming, friendly and helpful at every turn.  The lobby is set in pavilion at the edge of a lush garden under a 1000 year-old Banyan tree.  Our Deluxe room featured a 5m ceiling, an enormous bed, a sitting balcony overlooking the trees and a spacious bath.  The restaurant feels like a tree house overlooking the river.
title: Tranquil resort hotel in a natural setting

text:
Honeymooners
We booked this hotel only through the TripAdvisor recommendations and the lovely pictures we saw.
When we arrived we where stunned. 
The staff is very very friendly and helpful! 
We just had breakfast there, it was vegetarian and gluten free (don't know about the cupcakes), and let me tell you as a meat addict, it was great!!!
Buffet isn't that big but amazing in quality and taste.
The rooms are a bit dark but that's the only downside to them. It's very clean and luxury. 

The hotel has opened only recently and there is still some construction going on but that didn't bother us.

Its a wonderful place to calm down, surrounded by a great scenery and nature, but also close to Ubud Downtown. 

Highly recommend and would stay there anytime again!
title: Great stay, bit expensive but worth it!

text: So close to the city. A few minute drive or if you like walking, maybe a 15-20 minute walk.  Amazingly peaceful.  The rooms are spotless.  The whole resort is very Balinese and you feel like you are experiencing the true culture & feel of Ubud.  Highly recommended!
title: Amazing! Incredible value for money.

text: This beautiful resort has only been open for 2 months and is a hidden gem in Ubud. It's build around an old temple and therefore has a very special vibe. The staff is excellent: very welcoming and helpful. They think of your needs before you need them...everything to give you the peace of mind you may need. They also have a very good restaurant and spa with very professional staff as well. Although it's only a 10 minute walk down to the busy centre of Ubud, you will find the peace and quiet you're looking for. We would recommend this hotel to any couple visiting Ubud.
title: A hidden gem

text: Truly a beautiful and tranquil setting. Looking out over the river to rice paddies in the distance , staff are excellent and accommodating good not ask for better. My wife and I would highly recommend . If you are looking for a true Ubud experience this is the place! wish I could give it another star :)
title: Relaxing and wonderfull

text: Although we did not stay at this hotel, we visited the Spa twice. What a fabulous experience, with a view over the river, the peaceful sound of birds, luscious green landscape, wonderful massage and scented petals in the bath afterwards. Everything was just perfect. I was so relaxed and happy and would go back in a heartbeat. I highly recommend the spa treatments there.
title: Fantastic Spa Experience

owner_response.text: Thank you for the post. On your next visit please give us the oppertunity to host your stay. Again thanks.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: This resort is breathtaking and it feels like the whole resort is floating in the trees over Ubud's Campuhan River. The ambiance is peaceful and serene, especially at the Ayusha Wellness Spa, where you can get massages and other spa treatments in an open room floating over the beautiful Campuhan River below. The staff was very accommodating and pleasant. Overall,  what made the resort unique was its gorgeous surroundings- lush tropical greenery, traditional balinese architecture, winding stairs leading throughout the lush vegetation, hidden bungalows that seemed to float in the trees (easily used for yoga, meditating, reading, relaxing etc.), an infinity pool overlooking the river, and a restaurant that served traditional balinese cuisine that again felt like a floating large treehouse. A very unique and one of a kind place! I would definitely go back and recommmend it to friends as it is a true glimpse of how beautiful Ubud is and how wonderful the Balinese culture and environment can be!
title: A gem in Ubud, Bali!

text:
I went to Adiwana not for the first time, and lost in counting tbh! I keep coming back because I feel the good vibe and of course good service from the staff especially Mbak Puspa, she is really helpful. Other staff as well! They always welcome me as a family. 

This time I stayed with my mom, to introduce her to the resort, and she loves it! My mom is 63 years old, ofc she loves a place that can provide peacefulness and comfort at her age, and Adiwana delivers it really well.

Will come back for sure!
title: Makes me want to come back!

text: Adiwana Svarga Loka was our first stop in Bali. The location was great, a nice distance away from the busyness of Ubud centre, situated right on a river that created a lovely ambience at all times. The dinners were delicious with a nice selection on the menu. The hotel room, facilities and staff were great, it was just a shame that we were there during a yoga teacher training, because it meant that it was quite busy and noisy at times. I might suggest checking what events are going on before booking, if you are looking for tranquility. Finally, it was lovely to chat to I Made Weda in the restaurant, who always had a smile on his face and would go out of his way to make us feel welcome. And we have to add that the free yoga classes every morning we’re a nice touch 👌

text: I spent over 1 week at Adiwana Svarga Loka, and it was easily the most comfortable, relaxing, and peaceful place that I stayed during my time in Ubud. Even though it's located so centrally, and close to many main attractions (it's literally a short walk to get to the Campuhan Ridge Walk), it is so quiet, peaceful and natural that you can forget just how close to the centre of things you are. My room was beautiful (with the most comfy bed ever and a lovely balcony). There are lots of activities that the hotel can arrange for you to do during your stay, like yoga, meditation classes, tours etc. I chose to learn how to make daily offerings, with Puspa, and it was my favourite morning. I also received a purification blessing which was wonderful. During the week I also did a half day tour which was so affordable and easy to organize! There is also a great selection of treatments and massages in the Spa. I chose the 2 hour package, which was so lovely and relaxing. Emi is an amazing masseuse, and during your treatment you're surrounded by beautiful views and the sounds of nature. For me, the highlight of my stay were the incredible staff, who were just so kind, welcoming and friendly. The hospitality at Adiwana is second to none, and as a solo traveller it's something I really value. A huge big thank you to Puspa, Muri, Mira, Emi Dede, Adi, Rowena and all of the incredible team at Adiwana! I can't wait to return :)
title: A little slice of paradise :)

I would highly recommend this place. It’s in Ubud which makes it easy to explore the area. It’s not too far from the the center of the town as well. 
The breakfast was amazing and we really appreciated the option to have free breakfast any time of the day. The restaurant is also good and prices quite decent.
I would also recommend the SPA which offers massages and other treatments. Some prices are better than others but look out for the SPA package that includes three treatments.

Breakfast was good, you got to pick from a menu, big plus that you could order your "breakfast" whenever during the restaurants opening hours. 
The best part was the staff. Everyone was so friendly and kind, had 0 issues whatsoever. 

Only thing missing was a mirror (we only had one in the bathroom) and a fridge in the room. 

If I return to Ubud I would definitely stay here again.

+ the Hotel has a very unique and big jungel like garden
+ they offer free daily activities from yoga to martial arts classes
+ the staff is extraordinary friendly
+ within a 10 minutes walk you can reach Ubud center with all it's Bars and Shops and Restaurants
+ the rooms are very spacious and have a big balcony and are clean
+ the Spa is definately worth a visit

Tip: 
- Bring your mosquito spray since there are a lot of them (it's normal in a green area as
 this is)
- Prepare to hear some animals during the night (geckos) or early in the morning (rooster's, birds etc.)
- next to the property is a big buildig site where a new Hotel will be built. But there
 was not much noise during our stay so we didn't feel disturbed.

Overall a beautiful place to stay which we definately recommend for everyone who us looking for quite sanctuary outside noisy Ubud.
title: A beauiful place in walking distance to Ubud center

text:
Arrived at this place totally without expectation, booked mainly due to its proximity and convenience. 
It than greeted with a warm huge energizing hug of the ancient Banyan tree and the hospitality of the Balinese people.
I stayed for 3nights, left energized and refreshed. Barely left the hotel despite my initial need of being close to the city!

Hotel has daily activities, yoga meditation and walks to the Campuhan river, all worthwhile participating in. Inhouse massage center does a fantastic job and is reasonably priced. Restaurant under the banyan tree, was the best part. Sitting there sipping tea feeling the breeze listening to the wind chimes.. absolutely what the doctor prescribed!

The only cons beings the rooms had very thin walls so privacy is an issue, rooms are a bit outdated w plumbing issues and stained sheets/ covers. Major construction work adjacent is an eyesore with some noise pollution. Next door pig farming has strong odors wafting in and disrupting. 

Despite all these little bumps,I had a very enjoyable stay. Special shout out the entire team at Svarga Loka, from the caretakers, masseuse, front desk, housekeeping, waitstaff at the restaurant and Pak Ida Bagus - Thank you for making my stay memorable!
title: Tranquil, energizing With a few bumps

text:
Had such a wonderful stay here at Adiwana Svarga Loka. Met the manager and the owners who were all so lovely and made our stay very special here. Thank you Manager for the warm welcome. I love that everyone has a huge smile to give to the guests here. 

Svarga Loka is actually a huge property that you can go around and explore especially when visiting the two pools at the back. There is a serene area where you can just take in the air and see the sacred Campuhan River. There is construction of a horrible structure right across on the other side of the river that definitely ruins the view. I wish that the people of Ubud could see how harmful that could be especially when built so close to the river. I hope that something can be done. You can hear construction during the daytime but it didn't really bother me at night and I still had a good sleep. 

Will definitely come back to this hidden gem with a huge sacred tree beside the breakfast area. Love that it's so hidden despite being near the center of Ubud. It is an uphill climb to the resort but not to worry because I definitely needed the exercise. They also provide free shuttle to and from Ubud Palace so there's no problem at all. 

Can't wait to go back!!! :D
title: Such a Special Place!! Right beside Campuhan River

text:
If I had a chance to stay in this hotel as recent as 2 years ago, I would say this place is heaven. 

Alas the onslaught of us tourists means more concrete buildings to accommodate us. Opposite the hotel across the Campuhan river a massive concrete building is being constructed dangling threateningly near the cliff edge. This construction takes away the tranquil greenery and privacy Adiwana guests used to enjoy. So much so i suspect Adiwana has to move its spa and eatery inwards. 

Our room is inwards, away from the cliff but next to a neighbouring hut with several chickens. Every morning at around 4.30am, the roosters will crow non-stop till night time. At attractive promotion price for couples, we had spa but had to endure manure smell from neighbouring (farm?) and noise from the hotel's kitchen next door. Hotel breakfast is reasonably priced though portions may be small for men and we had to wait for quite a while.

Room and hotel grounds are clean and pleasant. I enjoyed napping at the room's balcony to make up for lost sleep. Staff service is superb. Security is tight with friendly guards. The hotel provides free activities such as yoga sessions and making offering which I enjoyed very much. 

Overall this is hotel is still a good stay for short stop near Ubud palace.
title: Tourism killed Ubud's nature

text: This is my 3rd visit to Svarga Loka.  The beautiful and tranquil grounds of this resort are set back from the main street in Penestanan village, only a short walk to central Ubud.  The rooms were clean and well appointed.  The meals at the resort restaurant were delicious and there are several other very good warungs and cafes nearby if you'd like to explore other eateries.  The daily complimentary afternoon tea was a wonderful and unexpected bonus.    As always, it is the staff that impress me most.  This resort has several staff that have worked here for many years. I have found them to be consistently obliging, friendly and unfailingly helpful.  They go out of their way to make each guest's experience as pleasant and enjoyable as possible.  Sri and Kadek at reception,  Weda and his staff in the restaurant and Puspa, Tari and the staff at Ayusha spa are a few of the names I remember.  Svarga Loka is indeed very lucky to have these long-serving staff in their employment.  Without them, a stay at Svarga Loka would not be the same.  Hope to see you again on my next visit.
title: Svarga Loka - Beautiful surroundings and great staff

text:
A luxury Wellness Hotel tucked away off the busy streets of Ubud central over looking the jungle. 

The staff are all incredible with our main man Suar welcoming us and looking after us. 

With healthy breakfast and drinks available all day. Free yoga, martial arts and other relaxing classes available each day,  you can really unwind and enjoy yourself,  or just hang by one of their 2 pools with a healthy cocktail! ;)

The staff are super helpful,  the rooms are super nice (and have nets around the bed for bite-less nights), and it's a 10 minute walk into central Ubud. (They also do a shuttle every 2hrs or you can get one on demand for idr50,000)

We've hopped all over the place for the past few weeks and this hotel tops them all!

...p.s. there is a building site opposite the canyon by the pool, it's not that loud, and if you're out and about exploring every day, it's all done and quiet before you're home. 

Thanks for a great stay guys x

text:
Suksma - This means 'Thank you' on Bali. I wanna first say 'Thank you' to the whole Svarga Loka staff. 
During our stay, we met beautiful people from the hotel staff who helped us so kindly and always with a smile to give us the best stay. I believe that this all comes from the heart and I felt like being home away from my home. My special thanks go to Bagus and Sri and of course all of you. You were way too nice and friendly to us, giving us great advise our our trip and showing us also different aspects of Bali and Ubud. 
I loved our Bungalow, the whole atmosphere was outstanding and I haven't slept so well in my entire life. The full service was more than one can expect. My heart was crying when we had to leave. And I mean this. It was more than just a Resort. To me it almost felt like home. I wished I could have stayed longer and get to know more about the area. 
The Svarga Loka Resort is perfectly embedded in the Nature itself. The plants, the trees, all gives one the character of being in paradise. The whole facility is well maintained and what I liked the most was the respectful exposure to the nature. I loved to sit on the balcony in the evening, watching the night sky or the fireflies or just listen to the rain and the nature responding to it. It had something healing. 

The Svarga Loka is amazing because the people who work there are amazing and deserve the very best review. 

Please keep this up and know that a place like yours is rare and very special, well it is at least to us, Alicja & Olga from Germany (Munich & Berlin). Hopefully we will see soon again. 

Suksma (Thank you)
title: Home away from Home

text:
This place is laden with insects.  While ubud is a tropical place and insects are expected,  what was irritating was that their mosquito nets were torn and the doors had large gaps and holes in them. It was a svarga (meaning heaven) for mosquitos with so many tourists to bite. Attached are pics showing insect bites inspite of using Deet 30% and mosquito repellent coils. The insects could get inside the room through the doors entire night. Staff changed my mosquito nets 3 times only to find huge holes in those nets every single time. 

The hotel has character and a local vibe but so do other hygienic places nearby. Given that mosquito infected diseases like dengue has no medicine,  I find this hotel very disturbing (room 208 to be specific).  Save yourself and grab a room in a better place where doors and nets are in good state.
title: Svarga loka is insect loka

text:
We stayed here couple of nights. First of all, smoking seems to be banned on the whole area. For us it was not a problem. However, there was no information regarding the ban when booking the hotel, so this might be unpleasant suprise for someone. 

The hotel area is beautiful and well maintained. The only annoyance was construction site just across the river, which was rather noisy. Due to the construction, part of the facilities near river were closed. Additionally the construction spoiled the view from both pools.

Rooms are rather small, but well maintained and clean. Balcony was really nice and spacious.

I cannot comment on wellness services as we did not use them.

Staff is super friendly and helpful. Motorbike rental was arranged by the hotel upon request.

Staff ia super friendly.

text:
We had a great experience at the Svarga Lola Resort. The Resort’s Spa recognized it was my fiancé’s birthday from our paperwork and surprised her with a small cake and birthday wishes! It made her day and exemplifies the resort’s attention to detail. 

One area of improvement would be the resort’s guided hikes. Our guide had scheduled us to hike the nearby Campuhan Ridge Walk. We had hiked that same trail the previous day, and as we were the only people on the guided hike, asked if there was another nearby trail we could do. Our guide said no, and claimed this is the only trail the resort does. There is more than one trail worth hiking in Ubud and it would be nice to offer guests an option of hiking and walking trails.

The grounds of the resort are lovely and shady, as they preserved all of the old growth trees. We had nice breakfasts too. Overall, our experience was very positive and we’d recommend the Svarga Loka.
title: Celebrated our Birthday

text: Our first visit to Ubud and we stayed in Svarga Loka resort. Arriving even after 9 pm, I was still welcomed with a fresh towel and a cooling drink. We had room 303. Lovely with mosquito netting over the 2 twin beds. However, the room smelled of mold which I suspect was due to lack of airing and ventilation. The bathroom has 2 openings to an outdoor space but unfortunately the wooden blinds over these low doors were badly rotten and needed to be replaced immediately. Otherwise the bathroom had all the toiletries that the guest would need. Being a wellness hotel, bottles of alkaline water are provided. Inside the closet were batik kimonos, rubber slippers and a safe. Regarding the food, I would mention that only gluten free bread was on offer so if one is no a fan of this bread like me, it's very disappointing. They should have given at least another choice like wholewheat or multi cereal or nutty bread which are also healthy choices. The hotel's rooms were beautifully located all over the property. It's also worth mentioning that there are restaurants and shops outside of the hotel property. I also commend the most wonderful staff, they're all definitely assets of the hotel.
title: Absolutely for nature and wellness enthusiasts

owner_response.text:
Dear Ruizgen

I do appreciate your comments about our wonderful staff and I do pass these on through my department heads every morning.

I understand your comments about the mouldy smell, one of the challenges of a natural jungle resort is to balance the existing natural vegetation with open light spaces, and Bali in the rainy season presents a particular challenge with dampness. Having only begun as GM here on 1st of November please rest assured that this is a topic I am seeking to address using eco-friendly methods including.Vinegar and ozone treatments.

We are working on the menu selection, as a wellness resort, our aim is to serve wholesome, local, organic, homemade foods that support the health of our guests and I am delighted to have recently found a chef who is currently creating delicious, wellness cuisine. With low season we switched to a Special of the Day Whiteboard Menu which changes every 2 days – and most items of our standard menu are also still available. We are striving for a balance between variety and food wastage. With the new Banyan Café open under the central Banyan Tree, guests do not have to face the wooden stairs down to the main restaurant. I apologise that we did not meet your expectations this time.

We look forward to welcoming you back to Svarga Loka on your next trip to Bali – perhaps for one of our wellness retreats?

Kind regards,
Graham Rowe ND. DBM
General Manager
